DOC.brief_summary: The investigators attempted to determine the optimal dose of dexmedetomidine required for the successful insertion of LMA during propofol induction without a neuromuscular blocking agent.
DOC.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine for Laryngeal Mask Airway Insertion
DOC.detailed_description: After a predetermined bolus dose of dexmedetomidine was injected over 2 min, anesthesia was induced with propofol 2.0 mg/kg. After confirming the loss of eyelash reflex and the bispectral index (BIS) score decreased below 60, the insertion of LMA was attempted.
DOC.criteria: ASA III patients undergoing general anesthesia for short elective surgery (<1 hr) GE reflux obesity (BMI>30) anticipated difficult airway
